body_html:
I just installed the nightly pip in a fresh virtualenv, and:

$ python
Python 2.7.6 (default, Jun 22 2015, 17:58:13) 
[GCC 4.8.2] on linux2
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import tensorflow as tf
I tensorflow/stream_executor/dso_loader.cc:110] successfully opened CUDA library libcublas.so locally
I tensorflow/stream_executor/dso_loader.cc:110] successfully opened CUDA library libcudnn.so.5 locally
I tensorflow/stream_executor/dso_loader.cc:110] successfully opened CUDA library libcufft.so locally
I tensorflow/stream_executor/dso_loader.cc:110] successfully opened CUDA library libcuda.so.1 locally
I tensorflow/stream_executor/dso_loader.cc:110] successfully opened CUDA library libcurand.so locally
>>> tf.nn.log_poisson_loss
<function log_poisson_loss at 0x7fa705e0fde8>

So I don't know what's wrong with your install. We've got 99+ issues but a pip ain't one.

body:
I just installed the nightly pip in a fresh virtualenv, and:

```
$ python
Python 2.7.6 (default, Jun 22 2015, 17:58:13) 
[GCC 4.8.2] on linux2
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import tensorflow as tf
I tensorflow/stream_executor/dso_loader.cc:110] successfully opened CUDA library libcublas.so locally
I tensorflow/stream_executor/dso_loader.cc:110] successfully opened CUDA library libcudnn.so.5 locally
I tensorflow/stream_executor/dso_loader.cc:110] successfully opened CUDA library libcufft.so locally
I tensorflow/stream_executor/dso_loader.cc:110] successfully opened CUDA library libcuda.so.1 locally
I tensorflow/stream_executor/dso_loader.cc:110] successfully opened CUDA library libcurand.so locally
>>> tf.nn.log_poisson_loss
<function log_poisson_loss at 0x7fa705e0fde8>
```

So I don't know what's wrong with your install.  We've got 99+ issues but a pip ain't one.
